definition: ancient cooking cauldron with two looped handles and three or four legs/pot (dialect)/to enter upon a period of (classical)/Kangxi radical 206/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes
ancient cooking cauldron with two looped handles and three or four legs/pot (dialect)/to enter upon a period of (classical)/Kangxi radical 206/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: The famous passenger car, Sheng-Li (The Victory).
sentences.chinese: 鼎鼎大名的胜利号客车。

sentences.english: The man who achieved this influence was an unlikely candidate for such eminence.
sentences.chinese: 有这么大影响的人，未必一定会获得鼎鼎大名。

sentences.english: Professor Li is too well-known to require my introduction.
sentences.chinese: 李教授鼎鼎大名，恐怕不要我再介绍了。

sentences.english: Notoriety is often mistaken for fame.
sentences.chinese: 声名狼藉常被误认为鼎鼎大名。

sentences.english: March 8th 1921) on 15th May 1948. At the time, they were both two of the biggest stars in Hollywood.
sentences.chinese: 在当时，他们都是好莱坞鼎鼎大名的巨星。

sentences.english: There are, as we know, powerful and illustrious atheists.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道有些人是鼎鼎大名的强有力的无神论者。

definition: lit. like thunder piercing the ear/a well-known reputation (idiom)
famous name/your distinguished name/one's formal personal name
Daming county in Handan 邯鄲|邯郸[Han2 dan1], Hebei
to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
to count as number one (idiom); second to none/outstanding
